name: apples
result: Safe, but be sure to remove the seeds.

name: carrots
result: Yes, both raw and cooked carrots are safe, but be sure to cut into small pieces to prevent choking.

name: grapes
result: No, grapes contain toxic compounds and even small amounts can make your dog sick, causing kidney failure and even death.

name: raisins
result: No, raisins contain toxic compounds and even small amounts can make your dog sick, causing kidney failure and even death.

name: salt
result: Limit, high amounts of salt can cause fatal salt poisoning or water deprivation.

name: bacon
result: Never, bacon is typically high in salt, which can be harmful to dogs.

name: ham
result: Never, processed ham is typically high in salt, which can be harmful to dogs.

name: cooked pork
result: Yes, cooked pork without any added spices is safe for dogs.

name: raw pork
result: No, raw or undercooked pork could contain bacteria that can make dogs sick.

name: peanut butter
result: Yes, plain, unsalted peanut butter is safe, but it's high in fat and calories.

name: peanuts
result: Limit, plain and unsalted peanuts are safe for dogs to eat, but they are high in fat.

name: cooked eggs
result: Yes, cooked eggs are both safe and nutritious for dogs.

name: raw eggs
result: No, even if your dog doesn't get sick, they could spread the germs to you and other humans.

name: cooked salmon
result: Yes, cooked, boneless salmon is safe and nutritious for dogs.

name: chocolate
result: No, chocolate contains stimulants that could cause vomiting, diarrhea, and death.

name: cheese
result: Limited, cheese is safe for dogs in small quantities, but it can cause digestive issues.

name: toothpaste
result: No, toothpaste often contains xylitol and other chemicals that could cause illness and even death. Always use toothpaste designed for dogs.

name: coconut
result: Limit, coconut is safe for dogs, but is high in fat and calories.

name: blueberries
result: Yes, blueberries are safe and nutritious for dogs to eat.

name: cinnamon
result: Limit, cinnamon is non-toxic to dogs, but could irritate their mouth or digestive system.

name: mangoes
result: Limit, mangoes are safe and nutritious for dogs to eat in small quantities. Be sure to remove the skin and pit.

name: honey
result: Limit, honey is high in sugar, which can cause weight gain in dogs.

name: milk
result: Limit, milk can cause digestive issues including gas, vomiting, and diarrhea in dogs due to lactose intolerance.

name: turkey
result: Yes, plain turkey without added seasonings or sauces is safe for dogs. Be sure to remove the skin and bones.

name: rice
result: Yes, plain and cooked rice, either white or brown, is safe for dogs and very easy for them to digest.

name: beef
result: Yes, cooked beef without added seasonings or sauces is safe for dogs to eat.

name: lemons
result: No, lemons and limes contain psoralen, which can cause vomiting, diarrhea, and even death.

name: limes
result: No, lemons and limes contain psoralen, which can cause vomiting, diarrhea, and even death.

name: strawberries
result: Yes, strawberries are safe and nutritious for dogs to eat. Make sure to cut into small pieces.

name: raw yeast
result: No, raw yeast dough can expand in dogs' stomachs, causing severe bloating, difficulty breathing, and weakness.

name: banana
result: Yes, bananas are safe and nutritious for dogs to eat.

name: oranges
result: Limit, oranges are nutritious for dogs to eat, but can can digestive issues.

name: mushrooms
result: Yes, plain mushrooms bought at a store (not wild mushrooms) and without added seasonings are safe for dogs.

name: cooked potatoes
result: Limit, plain and cooked potatoes without added seasonings are safe for dogs, but they are high in carbs.

name: raw potatoes
result: No, raw potatoes contain solanine, a compound toxic to dogs.

name: celery
result: Yes, celery is a safe and nutritious for dogs to eat. Be sure to cut into dog size pieces.

name: cooked shrimp
result: Yes, cooked shrimp without added seasonings and sauces is safe and nutritious for dogs to eat. Be sure to remove the shell.

name: raw shrimp
result: No, raw shrimp can contain harmful bacteria that can make dogs sick.

name: cherries
result: Limit, pitted cherries are safe for dogs to eat, but can cause upset stomach and diarrhea. Be sure to remove the pits.
